title: Mercedes reveal 2017 car
text:
Mercedes reveal W08 car as F1 champions aim for four in a row Three-time world champions complete shakedown at Silverstone before official reveal Last Updated: 23/02/17 12:12pm Mercedes have revealed the new W08 car which they hope will lead the team to a fourth successive F1 World Championship double. 
Lewis Hamilton and new team-mate Valtteri Bottas will puill the wraps off the new challenger, after Brit completed a shakedown at Silverstone ahead of the start of winter testing next week. 
WATCH: Mercedes launch W08 at Silverstone 
The W08 is the successor to the 2016 challenger which claimed a record 19 victories last season. 
Mercedes have established themselves as F1's dominant force since the switch to hybrid turbo engines three years ago with three successive Drivers' and Constructors' Championships, along with 51 wins from 59 races. 
But the shake-up of the technical rules for 2017 is set to pose a renewed threat to their supremacy with rivals Red Bull, in particular, heavily tipped to mount a more sustained push for the world title. 
Mercedes go into the new season without their world champion driver after Nico Rosberg stunned F1 by quitting the sport within days of winning the 2016 title. 
The arrival of Bottas from Williams - a driver team chief Toto Wolff has described as a near like-for-like replacement for Rosberg - provides Mercedes with another highly-rated talent, but the Finn has yet to win a grand prix. 
Hamilton, Mercedes' 2014 and 2015 title winner, enters his fifth season at the team and has set his sights on winning the fourth world crown of his career. Who's who at Mercedes in 2017? Race driver
